item.title: 阿联酋批评欧盟将该国保留在黑钱 "黑名单 "上
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国批评欧盟将该国保留在打击非法资金流动方面存在战略缺陷的国家的 "黑名单 "上。【原文：The United Arab Emirates criticized the European Union for keeping the country on a “black list” of countries with strategic deficiencies in combating illicit money flows.】

item.title: 法国八个月来首次通过银行发行债券
item.description: 法国约八个月来首次通过银团债券销售筹集资金，这是对投资者胃口的一次考验，因为新政府正试图获得足够的支持以通过急需的预算。【原文：France is raising money through a syndicated bond sale for the first time in about eight months, a test of investor appetite as the new government attempts to muster enough support to pass a much-needed budget.】

item.title: 中国股市的关税缓和可能只是暂时的
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统上任第一天没有宣布对这个亚洲国家征收任何关税，这给了中国股市一个惊喜。但投资者们并没有高枕无忧。【原文：President Donald Trump gave China’s stock market a pleasant surprise by not announcing any tariffs on the Asian nation on his first day in office. But investors aren’t resting easy.】

item.title: 债券市场建议英国减少出售长期吉尔债券，以应对需求变化
item.description: 英国债券市场希望政府明年出售更少的长期金边债券，因为在借贷成本飙升之后，英国正在应对债务需求的变化。【原文：The UK bond market wants the government to sell fewer long-dated gilts next year as the country navigates shifting demand for its debt in the wake of a surge in borrowing costs.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席财务官称马斯克不应利用法律挑战进行竞争
item.description: 首席财务官萨拉-弗里尔（Sarah Friar）表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）为阻止 OpenAI 公司成为一家营利性公司而提出的法律挑战等同于 "法律战争"，这家 ChatGPT 制造商将他的投诉视为竞争手法。【原文：Elon Musk’s legal challenge to stop OpenAI Inc. from becoming a for-profit company is equivalent to “lawfare” and the ChatGPT maker views his complaints as competitive maneuvering, Chief Financial Officer Sarah Friar said.】

item.title: 摩根大通 "作战室 "审视特朗普就任总统的最初几天
item.description: 美国最大的银行资产和财富管理部门主管玛丽-埃多斯（Mary Erdoes）表示，摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. has deployed teams working overtime to analyze the impact of the early outlines of the policy shift under President Donald Trump, according to Mary Erdoes, chief of the asset and wealth management arm of America’s largest bank.】

item.title: 亲俄候选人在罗马尼亚五月投票前民调中领先
item.description: 一项民意调查显示，亲俄总统候选人卡林-乔治斯库（Calin Georgescu）在定于 5 月举行的罗马尼亚大选中遥遥领先。【原文：Pro-Russian presidential candidate Calin Georgescu is in the lead ahead of Romania’s elections scheduled for May, a poll showed, after his surprise win of the now canceled previous ballot threw the country into political crisis last year.】

item.title: Abrdn 流入 12 亿英镑，削减成本计划进展顺利
item.description: Abrdn Plc 第四季度净流入资金总额达 12 亿英镑（15 亿美元），这对陷入困境的资产管理公司来说是难得的喘息机会。【原文：Abrdn Plc reported £1.2 billion ($1.5 billion) in total net inflows in the fourth quarter, a rare respite for the struggling asset manager.】

item.title: 特朗普取消液化天然气出口禁令，欧洲天然气价格随之波动
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普取消了暂停新出口许可证的禁令，缓解了全球长期供应的不确定性，欧洲天然气价格出现波动。【原文：European natural gas prices fluctuated, as US President Donald Trump lifted a moratorium on new export licenses, easing uncertainty over longer-term global supply.】

item.title: 外汇期权交易商因特朗普关税举措而被迫改弦更张
item.description: 在退出看涨美元期权交易不到一天之后，一些杠杆基金发现，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普更新其关税立场之后，他们在周二又回到了美元期权交易中。【原文：Less than a day after exiting bullish dollar option trades, some leveraged funds found themselves back in them on Tuesday after US President Donald Trump updated his tariff stance.】

item.title: 野村的 Willcox 预计日本央行本周将加息
item.description: 野村控股公司批发部门主管预计日本央行本周将加息，同时对进一步加息采取 "谨慎态度"。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc.’s wholesale division chief expects the Bank of Japan to raise interest rates this week while taking a “cautious approach” on further hikes.】

item.title: 英国央行紧缩会议前英国工资增长创六个月新高
item.description: 英国工资增长速度回升至六个月来的最高点，令投资者对英国央行是否会在下个月进一步降息惶惶不安。【原文：UK wage growth picked up to a six-month high, keeping investors on tenterhooks over whether the Bank of England will cut interest rates further next month.】

item.title: 致命灾难发生六年后，矿山开始组建全球废物坝机构
item.description: 在巴西布鲁马迪尼奥（Brumadinho）镇，淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）拥有的一座大坝坍塌，造成 272 人死亡，六年后的本周二，一个旨在提高储存采矿产生的有毒废物（即尾矿）的水库安全性的国际研究所正式成立。【原文：An international institute that seeks to improve the safety of reservoirs that store toxic waste from mining known as tailings kicked off Tuesday, six years after the collapse of a dam owned by Vale SA killed 272 people in the Brazilian town of Brumadinho.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 11 月工资增长加速
马恒达首席执行官称 2030 年电动汽车将占产品组合的 30
item.description: 作为印度市值排名第二的汽车公司，马恒达有限公司（Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd）的目标是到 2030 年使其产品组合中四分之一以上实现电动化，并在快速增长的细分市场中与本地和全球竞争对手展开竞争。【原文：Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd aims to make more than a quarter of its portfolio electric by 2030 as India’s number two automobile company by market value takes on local and global rivals bolstering their EV line-up in the fast growing segment.】

item.title: 南非卡加尼亚戈警告美国政策可能减缓通货紧缩
item.description: 南非央行行长莱塞贾-卡尼亚戈（Lesetja Kganyago）警告说，如果美国的保护主义政策最终导致通胀，可能会破坏各国央行未来的降息行动，尽管目前有太多的 "变动因素"，无法确定前景。【原文：South African central bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago warned that US protectionist policies may derail future interest-rate cuts by central banks if they turn out to be inflationary, though there are currently too many “moving parts” to be certain about the outlook.】

item.title: 据说印度银行要求印度央行推迟四月流动性规定
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度一些最大的贷款机构正计划要求印度央行新任行长就拟议中的流动性规定做出让步，认为这些规定可能会阻碍促进贷款的努力。【原文：Some of India’s largest lenders are planning to request concessions from the new head of the nation’s central bank regarding proposed liquidity regulations, arguing the rules could hamper efforts to boost lending, according to people familiar with the developments.】

item.title: 中国推进自力更生阻碍了特朗普乐见的能源交易
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统暂缓对中国出口商品征收关税，同时他的政府正在审查其第一任期内达成的贸易协议，希望中国能更多地购买美国的石油、天然气和农产品。【原文：President Donald Trump has held off imposing tariffs on Chinese exports while his government reviews a trade deal struck during his first term, hoping for more purchases of US oil, gas and farm products.】

item.title: 狂人 "米莱伊在阿根廷大获全胜后重返达沃斯
item.description:
阿根廷总统实现了一年前很少有人认为可能实现的目标。他能否在2025年克服更大的挑战？【原文：

Argentina's president has achieved what few considered possible just a year ago. Will he be able to overcome even bigger challenges in 2025?

】

item.title: 瑞银停止部分新世界发展证券的保证金贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞银集团停止接受新世界发展有限公司的部分债券和股票作为保证金贷款的抵押品，与其他全球贷款机构一样，暂停向富裕客户提供此类融资。【原文：UBS Group AG halted accepting some bonds and shares of New World Development Co. as collateral for margin loans, joining other global lenders in suspending such financing for rich clients, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 土耳其滑雪胜地酒店火灾造成 10 人死亡
item.description: 土耳其内政部长阿里-耶尔利卡亚 X 日说，土耳其北部滑雪胜地一家酒店发生火灾，造成 10 人死亡，32 人受伤。【原文：A fire at a hotel in a ski resort in northern Turkey killed 10 people and injured 32, Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya said on X.】

item.title: 货币操纵警告引发对特朗普计划的争论
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上任的第一天就给全球市场带来了巨大冲击，交易员们将注意力集中在对货币操纵的警告上，这可能会引发未来更大的波动。【原文：Donald Trump’s first day in office has whipsawed global markets, with traders zeroing in on a warning over currency manipulation which may spark greater volatility ahead.】

item.title: 他是 Ba-a-a-ck。适应过山车
item.description:
特朗普在就职典礼上关于关税的每一句话（或不说话）都让美元狂飙突进，自从范-海伦（Van Halen）以来，巴拿马从未如此风靡一时。【原文：

The dollar had a wild ride with Trump’s every inaugural utterance (or not) on tariffs, and Panama hasn’t been this in vogue since Van Halen.

】

item.title: Zomato 盈利不及分析师预期，股价暴跌 13
item.description: 周二，Zomato Ltd.股价暴跌超过 13%，原因是快速商务部门的亏损导致该公司盈利低于分析师预期。【原文：Shares of Zomato Ltd. slumped more than 13% on Tuesday after losses in the quick commerce segment caused the company’s earnings to fall short of analyst estimates.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡齐米尔预计下周起将再减产三到四次
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员彼得-卡齐米尔表示，欧洲中央银行下周降息已成定局，随后可能还会有两到三次降息。【原文：A reduction in interest rates next week by the European Central Bank is all but certain and two to three more will probably follow, according to Governing Council member Peter Kazimir.】

item.title: 里夫斯警告投资者不会相信未来会削减开支
item.description: 如果财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）宣布更多延迟的支出限制措施，她将很难让伦敦金融城相信她的财政信誉，因为她已经试图在工党议会任期结束前做出政治上有争议的决定。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will struggle to convince the City of her fiscal credibility if she announces more delayed spending restraint, having already sought to move politically controversial decisions toward the end of Labour’s parliamentary term.】

item.title: 假日季度苹果公司 iPhone 在中国的销量骤降 18
item.description: 据独立调查显示，12 月份苹果公司 iPhone 手机在中国的销售量下降了 18.2%，这是该公司在继美国之后的最大市场遭遇的重大挫折。【原文：Sales of Apple Inc. iPhones dived 18.2% in China during the December quarter, according to independent research, a major setback for the company in its biggest market after the US.】

item.title: 交易员将目光从特朗普转向日本央行，日元表现优于十国集团同行
item.description: 周二，日元兑美元汇率在十国集团货币中独占鳌头，因为交易员们打赌唐纳德-特朗普的关税第一炮不会阻止日本央行周五可能的加息。【原文：The yen was alone among Group-of-10 currencies in rising against the dollar on Tuesday as traders wagered that Donald Trump’s first salvo on tariffs won’t stop a potential interest rate hike from the Bank of Japan on Friday.】

item.title: 削减钢材威胁南非 2,570 亿美元的建筑发展计划
item.description: 亿万富翁支持的安赛乐米塔尔公司（ArcelorMittal SA）计划关闭南非一家拥有百年历史的钢铁厂，这使西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）总统促进价值 2,570 亿美元的基础设施繁荣的梦想成为泡影。【原文：Billionaire-backed ArcelorMittal SA’s plans to shut down a century-old steel mill in South Africa are holding President Cyril Ramaphosa’s dream of fostering a $257 billion infrastructure boom to ransom.】

item.title: 台湾削减公用事业预算，可能增加电力成本
item.description: 台湾削减了 1,000 亿新台币（约合 31 亿美元）的资金，用于其陷入困境的公用事业，该公司可能会要求提高电费，这可能会影响到全球最大的几家芯片制造商。【原文：Taiwan cut NT$100 billion ($3.1 billion) of funding for its struggling utility, which may seek higher electricity rates that could impact some of the world’s biggest chipmakers.】
